title: Lorewise how powerful is Elementalist Lux?
body:
Just curious how does mastering all the elements stack up to the rest of the roster?

Would you rank her in the high end tier with Syndra, Xerath, Ryze, and Brand.

God tier with the likes of Zoe and Aurelio Sol.

Or still mid tier with normal mages like current Annie?

replies.body:
Whoa whoa, are you comparing skin universe lore with the main Runeterra setting? Because that could change EVERYTHING...

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

It was vaguely suggestrd that Elementalist Lux is what Lux could canonically become.  In specific one Rioter (can't remember who) said that it was an older Lux.


I'm pretty sure they just meant the Lux in Elementalist is older than Base, but I could see how some people thought it meant that it was outright Lux in the future.


If Elementalist Lux was main universe though, how would she compare?  If I had to guess I'd put her at around Syndra maybe a little lower.
The current understanding at Riot is that skins are not canon. I have mixed feelings on that, but I'm willing to take it as gospel for now.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=mYygtIEZ,comment-id=000200030000,timestamp=2018-10-09T17:55:30.602+0000)
>
> The current understanding at Riot is that skins are not canon. I have mixed feelings on that, but I'm willing to take it as gospel for now.

My current headcannon is that after Ryze manages to hide all the World Runes in that Petricite cave, same thing happens to that mountain that happened to Galio; It comes to life. The mountain (called Malphite obviously) ravages Demacia and older Lux gets a bit colorful with her powers trying to take it out, becoming Elementalist Lux in the process.

> The current understanding at Riot is that skins are not canon.

Is that an absolute statement, or do some exceptions still apply? The last time the topic was mentioned, Human Ryze or Traditional Sejuani were still considered canon.
Then there are skins based on canon stuff that obviously aren't canon, like the Bilgewater skins or Pentakill (who canonically rock Runeterra, but aren't part of our main canon).

Pentakill is not canon since the 2014 retcon at least... You're super outdated, mate ^^'

(And even then, Rioters said the band was canon, but the lore available on the first Pentakill website contradicted events in the JoJ.)

No, you misunderstood me.  Pentakill's lore takes place in Runeterra (lots of canon places namedropped).  They, like skins such as the Rogue Admiral Garen are not part of the main continuity, but take place in the same actual location.
Ah, yeah, sorry. You mean a third category. But that doesn't answer my question.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=mYygtIEZ,comment-id=000200030000,timestamp=2018-10-09T17:55:30.602+0000)
>
> The current understanding at Riot is that skins are not canon. I have mixed feelings on that, but I'm willing to take it as gospel for now.

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/marvelanimated/images/3/36/Spider-Men.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100926195903

It's only a matter of time {{champion:245}} {{champion:26}}

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=mYygtIEZ,comment-id=000200030000,timestamp=2018-10-09T17:55:30.602+0000)
>
> The current understanding at Riot is that skins are not canon. I have mixed feelings on that, but I'm willing to take it as gospel for now.

If Beemo and Pizza Delivery Sivir are not main-Universe canon, I'm not sure I can keep playing *League*...

I do get the conflict though. On the one hand, saying "this skin represents character X in the future" is AWESOME and gives really cool character growth. On the other hand, it locks you out of some storytelling options and flexibility with that character.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=mYygtIEZ,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-06T03:07:08.128+0000)
>
> Whoa whoa, are you comparing skin universe lore with the main Runeterra setting? Because that could change EVERYTHING...
> 
> {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

I get it this is a tease towards some sort of League multiverse effort and the recent Lucian and Kayn stories were an early experiment into that foray but I think the main universe should be the sole focus, at least until everything is set in stone

My bet for most powerful skins/skinlines if you suddenly and violently merged all the universes would be the celestial, darkstar, and final boss Veigar. Final boss Veigar is easily the strongest though cause he has cheat codes.

But if he has cheat codes, why did he get blown up by Arcade Sona?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CalmKsnMFXA

Because he's a video game villain. He has the unfortunate weakness of always being beatable by the player. Any of the arcade "players" ({{champion:103}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:21}} {{champion:92}}, and {{champion:37}}).


That said, that video voids that by turning Sona into DJ which would cause her to lose protagonists advantage. Sona threw that fight and was only saved by the creator's bias.
Well thats a fanmade video,so it hardly counts.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=mYygtIEZ,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-06T03:07:08.128+0000)
>
> Whoa whoa, are you comparing skin universe lore with the main Runeterra setting? Because that could change EVERYTHING...
> 
> {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

I always thought Elementalist Lux was like some sort of near future Lux where she understands her powers better, but still for the most part of the main setting.

I mean, there are plenty of side universes that could be expanded on. Take the Star Guardian universe, for example. That could have its own animated/comic book run, and people would enjoy it. Then there is the Pulsefire universe as well, who wouldn't enjoy a bit of sci-fi story?
I'd definitely place her on the higher-tier end of magic users; not a deity, but definitely stronger than the average spellcaster.
She's Mortal   so it doesn't matter how  powerful you are if you can be easily killed

> [{quoted}](name=Mordepool,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=mYygtIEZ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-10-05T23:18:17.301+0000)
>
> She's Mortal   so it doesn't matter how  powerful you are if you can be easily killed

She did tank a hit from a mountain sized monster in her cinematic without much issue so sheâ€™s fairly durable.

She even gains mind control powers through Mystic or at least its implied based off her comments.

Probably Ryze-level, though I can see her going past that. At least, I had her do that once in my ero-fanfic _(don't ask for links)_.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
LiNkS?/?
Sorry, can't link to erotic material.

If Elementalist Lux is Lux at the pinnacle of what she can attain I am not impressed. Everything Lux can do I can do better. And Lux pales in comparison to a real man like Ezreal.

http://www.auplod.com/u/pdolua802d6.png
ELEMENTALIST LUX HAS NO LORE
? it's a skin.
